remarks: Characterization of the substitutions as functions from expressions to expressions that distribute under concatenation and map constants to themselves.  (The constant part uses ` ( C \ V ) ` because we don't know that ` C ` and ` V ` are disjoint until we get to ~ ismfs .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jul-2016.)
statement:
mrsubccat.s $e |- S = ( mRSubst ` T ) $.
mrsubccat.r $e |- R = ( mREx ` T ) $.
mrsubcn.v $e |- V = ( mVR ` T ) $.
mrsubcn.c $e |- C = ( mCN ` T ) $.
elmrsubrn $p |- ( T e. W -> ( F e. ran S <-> ( F : R --> R /\ A. c e. ( C \ V ) ( F ` <" c "> ) = <" c "> /\ A. x e. R A. y e. R ( F ` ( x concat y ) ) = ( ( F ` x ) concat ( F ` y ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d C c x y $.
$d F c x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d S c x y $.
$d T x y $.
$d V c x y $.
$d W x y $.
